intro: Neeopsis, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Brassicaceae family. These plants are typically small, herbaceous perennials that thrive in rocky or alpine environments. They are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, four-petaled flowers that often appear in clusters. Neeopsis species are often found in temperate regions and are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Their ecological importance includes serving as a food source for various insect pollinators.
